basics.name: Alexis Paques
basics.label: Head of Robotics
basics.summary: I love to experience new technologies, hardware as well as software. I am a conscientious person who works hard to get the right/best result, depending on the deadline. In the meantime, I consider coding as an art. It is personal and it should beautiful to ourselves yet readable for the others. I am autodidact as well as flexible, I can learn new languages with ease.

work.summary: As the head of robotics, I build and manage the Robotics & IoT teams and projects as well as continuing to develop the platform. I work in the navigation, sensor drivers & integration, high-performance IPC stack and the cloud platform integration.

As the Lead Robotics Engineer, I lead the robotics team to develop autonomous robots according to the client needs and company requirements. As the Architect, I design both the software, the embedded hardware architecture and the network architecture to provide a modular autonomy to the robots and an easy to use Platform API.
highlights: Sorting Center Innovation of the Year: Autonomous sorting, PostExpo 2018

work.summary: In collaboration with the MIT (Boston, MA), the UCL (Belgium) have the project to build with multicopters and ground robots. I made a task-based abstraction layer, as well as a localization system, to allow Masters & PhD students to test their contributions on the multicopters in real conditions.
Invited two months at the MIT as part of my thesis on UAV autonomous control. During those 2 months, I added the RTK-based localization.
